content.description:
The quartzite rock is uniquely sculptured and polished. The few bolts encountered seem at times oddly placed, nevertheless, this is a fun climb with great movement.

Pitch #1: Climb up past the first bolt to a tricky roof where protection is either creative or on to a bolt past the spicy moves. Continue up the smooth spur to a two-bolt belay. 5.9+, 25m.

Rappel the route.
content.protection: QDs for 4 bolts. Some Aliens or C-3s can be comforting. Bolts are in good shape and the washer stacked chained anchor seems bomber.
content.location: The route ascends the prominent prow facing the creek and BCC road and the rock is cleaner than its neighbor to the left.

content.description:
This is the route just to the left and a little up hill from Water Crest and the only other route on this nice little wall I noticed. Stevo has moved on to more trout fishing than climbing and he can not recall the name of this line.

Pitch #1: Climb dirty, lichen covered quartzite quite a ways to the first bolt, then surmount a tricky bulgy roof and continue up thin edges on polished quartzite to the same two-bolt belay as for Water Crest.

Rappel the route.
content.protection:
QDs for about 5 bolts. Some additional small gear may supplement the fixed protection.

Shares the stacked washer / chain set up anchor with Water Crest.
content.location: 2m to the looker's left of Water Crest.
